ProgramName: Master of Education in Art Education
EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be done by providing an official TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo score report. The English proficiency requirement may be waived for applicants who have completed a bachelor's or a master's degree from a regionally accredited U.S. institution or a recognized university in a country where English is the official language.
Requirements: A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. A final undergraduate GPA of at least a 3.0. An official transcript from each institution where credits were earned. A 500-word statement addressing your career goals and how the KU M.Ed. in Art Education will help you achieve them. A portfolio of 15-20 images of your artwork. Two letters of recommendation from individuals who can speak to your academic and/or professional potential. A resume/CV. An active teaching certification is required to be admitted into the program. If you are not certified, please see our Art Education Certification Program. International applicants may have additional requirements.
Department: College of Visual and Performing Arts
Description: The Master of Education in Art Education degree program is a 33-credit program for students who currently have a teaching certificate in art. It is designed to further develop artistic and creative talents, deepen knowledge of art history and criticism, investigate contemporary issues and trends in art education, and renew and invigorate the spirit of professionalism. The M.Ed. in Art Education is accredited by the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD).
Accredidation: accredited by the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD)
ScholarshipAmount: Up to $5,000 stipend plus a tuition waiver per academic year

EnglishScore: Graduate applicants must demonstrate English proficiency by one of the following: A TOEFL score of 79 or higher on the internet-based test (iBT), an IELTS score of 6.5 or higher, a Duolingo English Test score of 105 or higher, a Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic score of 53 or higher, successful completion of the ELS Language Center's level 112, or graduation from a U.S. college or university or from a college or university in a country where English is the official language.
Requirements: Completed online application and payment of the application fee. An official transcript from each college or university attended. A Bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited institution with a major in Art with a minimum GPA of 3.0. Statement of goals. Two letters of recommendation. Portfolio of 20 images of personal artwork. Successful interview with the Art Education Graduate Coordinator. Basic skills testing requirements as mandated by the Pennsylvania Department of Education must be met.
Department: College of Visual and Performing Arts
Description: The Art Education Certification program at Kutztown University is an intensive post-baccalaureate program designed for individuals who hold a bachelor’s degree in studio art and now wish to become certified to teach art in Pennsylvania’s public schools, grades pre-kindergarten to 12. Graduates of the program will meet all requirements for a Level I Teaching Certificate. KU's Art Education certification program consists of 33 credits, 27 in art education and 6 in student teaching. The Art Education Certification Program is designed for post-baccalaureate students who already hold a bachelor’s degree in studio art, from an accredited college or university, with a minimum of 40 studio credits. The program results in initial certification only. It does not culminate in a master’s degree. Students who wish to obtain a master’s degree in art education must apply for admission to that program.
Accredidation: Kutztown University is accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education and the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD).
ScholarshipAmount: Graduate Assistantships provide a stipend of $2,500 or $5,000 per semester, plus a full tuition waiver of up to 9 credits per semester.

ProgramName: Master of Fine Arts in Communication Design
EnglishScore: If your native language is not English, you will be required to submit proof of English proficiency. You may prove your proficiency by providing one of the following: TOEFL - a minimum score of 79 on the iBT (internet-based test) or 550 on the pBT (paper-based test). IELTS - a minimum score of 6.5. Duolingo - a minimum score of 105. Pearson (PTE) - a minimum score of 53. ELS Language Center - a level 112 certificate. Proof of a bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited U.S. college or university.
Requirements: To be considered for the M.F.A. in Communication Design program, applicants must submit the following: A completed graduate application; a non-refundable $35 application fee; a bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited institution; official undergraduate/graduate transcripts from all colleges/universities attended; a minimum 3.00 GPA is required for all undergraduate/graduate work; a 500-word Statement of Intent outlining your purpose in pursuing graduate study in Communication Design; a portfolio of 15-20 images of your most accomplished work; a current résumé; and two letters of recommendation. An on-campus or telephone interview may be required.
Department: College of Visual and Performing Arts
Description: The Master of Fine Arts in Communication Design program at Kutztown University is a 60-credit degree designed to foster the individual voice and advance the skills of designers who wish to contribute to the global community in a meaningful way. Our nationally ranked MFA program is the only program of its kind in the Pennsylvania State System of Higher Education (PASSHE) and one of the largest graduate Communication Design programs in the country.
Accredidation: The Master of Fine Arts in Communication Design is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD).
ScholarshipAmount: Graduate Assistantships provide a stipend of $2,500, $5,000, or $10,000 per year and a waiver of tuition.

ProgramName: Master of Education in Music Education
EnglishScore: Proof of English Proficiency is required of all students whose first language is not English. Acceptable forms of proof include: TOEFL minimum score of 79 on the iBT, IELTS minimum score of 6.5, Duolingo minimum score of 100, or successful completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: Complete the online application. Pay the application fee. Official transcripts from all colleges/universities attended. A cumulative undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher is required. A bachelor’s degree in Music Education from an accredited institution. A copy of teaching certification. Three letters of recommendation. A two-to-three page personal essay (statement of goals). Submission of a videotape demonstrating musical skills.
Department: College of Visual and Performing Arts
Description: The Master of Education in Music Education is a fully online program designed for the certified, practicing music educator. The purpose of this program is to expand the student's understanding and application of pedagogy, research, and philosophy in order to improve and inform their teaching in the P-12 music classroom. The Master of Education in Music Education offers a choice between two tracks, Thesis and Non-Thesis, and may be completed in two years. Courses are offered on a rotating cycle and taught by the accomplished and diverse music faculty in the Music Department.
Accredidation: Kutztown University is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM).

EnglishScore: Kutztown University requires all international students to provide proof of English Proficiency. This requirement can be fulfilled by ONE of the following: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) score of 79 on the iBT (internet-based test). The institutional code for Kutztown University is 2362. IELTS (International English Language Testing System) band score of 6.5. Must be the academic version of the exam. Duolingo score of 105. ELS Language Center Level 112. Proof of having received a degree from a U.S. college or university. Proof of having received a degree from a foreign university where the language of instruction is English.
Requirements:
In addition to the University's general requirements for admission to a graduate program, applicants for admission to the Music Education Certification program must meet the following criteria:
1. A baccalaureate degree in music (e.g. B.M., B.S. or B.A. in Music) from a regionally accredited institution with a minimum GPA of 3.0. A review of official transcripts from all institutions attended is required.
2. Passing scores on the PAPA (Pre-service Academic Performance Assessment) in Reading, Writing and Mathematics, or waiver via qualifying SAT or ACT scores. For further information about qualifying scores for the waiver, please go to the PDE website. Passing scores on all tests must be presented before formal admission can be granted.
3. A 300-500 word essay describing the applicant’s professional goals and reasons for pursuing certification.
4. Two letters of recommendation from persons who are able to comment on the applicant's potential for success as a music educator.
5. A resume which includes a listing of music experiences since graduation from high school (private lessons, performing ensembles, teaching positions, and other related employment).
6. Successful completion of the Music Department audition/interview.
Department: College of Visual and Performing Arts
Description: The Music Education Certification Program at Kutztown University provides an opportunity for individuals who hold an undergraduate degree in music to complete the coursework required to be recommended for Pennsylvania teacher certification in music. The program is specifically designed to meet the needs of each individual student and can include undergraduate prerequisite courses and deficiencies in addition to the professional education sequence of courses. An initial review of the student's undergraduate transcript will determine the required music and education coursework to be completed for certification.
Accredidation: Kutztown University is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM).

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be demonstrated by submitting a TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, or Duolingo score, or through other approved methods.
Requirements: Completed online application. Official transcripts from ALL colleges/universities attended. A current resume. A personal statement outlining career goals and motivation for pursuing an MBA. Two letters of recommendation. GMAT is not required but scores can be submitted for consideration. Minimum 3.0 undergraduate GPA (on a 4.0 scale).
Department: College of Business
Concentration: General, Supply Chain Management and Logistics, Health Care Management, Leadership, Finance, Business Analytics, Marketing
Description: The Kutztown University Master of Business Administration program provides students with a high-quality graduate business education. Our comprehensive curriculum is designed to give students the theoretical background and practical skills needed for success in today's competitive global business environment. Students in the program develop skills in problem-solving, strategic thinking, and managing people and resources. Courses are taught by a distinguished faculty that are experts in their fields and are also dedicated teachers. Our students represent a diverse mixture of business professionals and managers, recent college graduates, and people seeking a career change. Because of this, the Kutztown MBA curriculum is designed with flexibility in mind. Courses are scheduled in the evening to accommodate our many working students. We also offer a 100% online MBA program. In addition to a general MBA, we offer a variety of in-demand academic tracks and certificate programs.
Accredidation: Kutztown University's College of Business is an accredited member of AACSB International, which represents the highest standard of achievement for business schools worldwide. Less than 5% of the world's 13,000 business programs have earned AACSB Accreditation. This distinction is the hallmark of excellence in business education.
ScholarshipAmount: $5,000 stipend plus tuition waiver for 18 credits

EnglishScore: International students whose native language is not English are required to provide proof of English proficiency by one of the following options: TOEFL (79 IBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (overall band score of 6.5), PTE Academic (score of 53), Duolingo English Test (score of 105), or ELS Language Center (Level 112 with a grade of B or higher).
Department: College of Business
Description: The Graduate Certificate in Business Decision-Making is designed for individuals who have already earned an undergraduate degree and wish to continue their education at the graduate level to make more effective and efficient data-driven business decisions. Decision-making is a critical skill for any business leader. The curriculum provides a strong foundation in core analytical and quantitative business concepts to allow a leader to use business information and data for more effective decisions. This certificate is ideal for those who are looking to advance in their career or who are considering a graduate degree in business. This 12-credit certificate can be a stand-alone credential or it can be a pathway to the Kutztown University MBA program. Students who successfully complete the graduate certificate with a GPA of 3.0 or higher are eligible to have their GMAT/GRE requirement waived for admission into the Kutztown MBA program. All credits earned in the certificate program can be applied to the KU MBA.
Accredidation: The College of Business at Kutztown University is accredited by AACSB International, The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business. This accreditation represents the highest standard of achievement for business schools worldwide.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Computer Science
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to take an English proficiency exam. The following are the minimum scores required for admissions consideration: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) score of 79 (IBT) or 550 (PBT); IELTS (International English Language Testing System) score of 6.5; Duolingo score of 105; PTE Academic score of 53; ELS Language Center Level 112.
Requirements:
In addition to the University graduate admission requirements, the MS in Computer Science program requires:
- A baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited institution.
- Official transcripts from all institutions attended.
- A minimum cumulative undergraduate GPA of 3.00 (on a 4.0 scale).
- An undergraduate major in Computer Science or a closely related field is recommended. Students with other backgrounds may be admitted, but may be required to take up to four preparatory courses.
- Two letters of recommendation.
- A statement of purpose outlining the applicant's goals and objectives for pursuing the MS in Computer Science.
- International students must demonstrate English proficiency.
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: The Master of Science degree in Computer Science is designed for students who have a bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field. The program is specifically designed to expand the students' knowledge and expertise in the field of computer science and information technology. The graduate program includes advanced topics in software engineering, database management, high-performance computing, data analytics, and machine learning. In this program, students will learn advanced topics in computer science and also get a hands-on experience by completing a final project/thesis.

EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting one of the following: TOEFL with a minimum score of 79 (iBT) or 550 (PBT); IELTS with a minimum score of 6.5; Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 105; Pearson PTE with a score of 53; or proof of completion of ELS Level 112.
Department: College of Business
Description: The MBA Data Analytics Certificate is for business professionals who seek to enhance their managerial and decision-making skillsets through data analysis. It covers topics such as regression, data mining, text mining, forecasting, and visualization in a business context. Students will acquire hands-on experience by applying these techniques to business problems, using popular software packages such as Excel, Tableau, and SAS Viya. All courses are applicable toward a KU MBA degree. Students can complete this certificate in addition to an MBA degree from KU or from another AACSB accredited business school. Students who complete the certificate can waive the GMAT requirement to join the KU MBA program.
Accredidation: The College of Business at Kutztown University is an accredited member of AACSB International.
ScholarshipAmount: Stipends range from $2,500 to $10,000 per year plus tuition waiver for assistantships.

EnglishScore: For international applicants, proof of English proficiency is required. Accepted tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL - 79, IELTS - 6.5, Duolingo - 100, Pearson's Test of English (PTE) - 53, or successful completion of ELS level 112. Exemptions may apply for those who meet specific criteria, such as being a citizen of certain English-speaking countries or having a degree from a U.S. institution.
Requirements: All applicants must apply online and submit the following documents: 1. Official transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended, with a GPA of 3.0 or higher preferred. 2. Two letters of recommendation from professional or academic references. 3. A written statement of professional goals. 4. Current resume.
Department: College of Business
Description: The Kutztown University Graduate Certificate in Leadership program provides students the opportunity to gain relevant leadership skills and knowledge from MBA-level coursework. These courses are designed to give students practical tools to effectively lead, motivate and communicate in a dynamic and diverse workforce. The courses taken for this certificate may be applied to the Kutztown University MBA program.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by AACSB International, a benchmark for business school quality. Less than 5% of the world's 13,000 business programs have earned AACSB Accreditation.

EnglishScore: All students for whom English is not their native language must demonstrate proficiency by providing one of the following: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) with a minimum score of 79 on the iBT (internet-based test) or 550 on the PBT (paper-based test); IELTS (International English Language Testing System) with a minimum overall band score of 6.5; Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 105; Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic with a minimum score of 53; Successful completion of an ELS (English Language Service) language center program, level 112. The English language proficiency requirement may be waived for students who have earned a degree from a U.S. institution or a pre-approved country where English is the official language.
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: The Master of Public Administration (MPA) program at Kutztown University prepares students for careers as leaders and managers in the public and nonprofit sectors. Our graduates are equipped with knowledge of the values and ethics of public service and skills in policy analysis, program evaluation, budgeting and human resource management. The 36-credit hour MPA program combines a core curriculum in public administration with career-track specializations. Courses are offered in a flexible format, using a combination of in-person, hybrid and online classes to meet the needs of our diverse student population. Classes are taught by full-time faculty who hold doctoral degrees in public administration or a related field and have professional experience at all levels of government and nonprofit management.
Accredidation: Kutztown University's Master of Public Administration (MPA) program is accredited by the Network of Schools of Public Policy, Affairs, and Administration (NASPAA) Commission on Peer Review and Accreditation and is listed on the Annual Roster of Accredited Programs in conformity with NASPAA standards. NASPAA is the recognized global accreditor of master's degree programs in public administration, public policy, public affairs, and nonprofit and related fields.
ScholarshipAmount: Stipends of $2,500, $3,750, or $5,000 per academic year are available through Graduate Assistantships.

ProgramName: Master of Education in Student Affairs in Higher Education
EnglishScore: All international applicants must demonstrate a satisfactory level of English proficiency. This is normally done by submitting official results of an English proficiency test such as TOEFL, IELTS, PTE Academic, or Duolingo English Test. The minimum acceptable scores for admission are: TOEFL - 79 (internet-based), IELTS - 6.0, PTE Academic - 53, and Duolingo English Test - 105.
Department: College of Education
Concentration: ['Student Affairs Practice', 'College Student Development and Services']
Description: The Master of Education in Student Affairs in Higher Education is designed to prepare students for a variety of student affairs positions in a college or university setting. The curriculum emphasizes the integration of theory and practice to prepare graduates for entry and mid-level student affairs positions. The program consists of 36 credit hours, which includes an internship experience. This program also fulfills the educational requirements for students to pursue licensure as professional counselors in Pennsylvania and other states. Our program is unique in its flexibility. We offer a variety of course formats, including in-person, hybrid, and fully online, to best meet student needs. Students who are currently working full time in a student affairs setting may choose to complete a 36-credit curriculum that does not include the internship. This non-internship track of the Student Affairs in Higher Education program provides those already working in the field with the knowledge and skills necessary to enhance their professional competence as well as the opportunity for advancement to more responsible positions.
Accredidation: The Student Affairs in Higher Education program at Kutztown University is consistent with the standards established by the Council for the Advancement of Standards in Higher Education (CAS).

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Addiction Counseling
EnglishScore: All students for whom English is not their native language must submit proof of English proficiency. This can be met via TOEFL (minimum 79 iBT), IELTS (minimum 6.5), Duolingo (minimum 105), PTE Academic (minimum 53), or completion of ELS Level 112. Other exemptions are available for students who completed coursework or high school in the US, or are from certain English-speaking countries.
Department: College of Education

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Clinical Mental Health Counseling
EnglishScore: Official test results of the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or International English Language Testing System (IELTS) is required for all students for whom English is not their first language. A minimum score of 550 on the paper-based test or 213 on the computer-based test or 79 on the internet-based test is required on the TOEFL for admission. A minimum score of 6.5 is required on the IELTS. Successful completion of level 112 in the English Language Services (ELS) program will be accepted in lieu of the TOEFL or IELTS.
Requirements:
A completed online application
Official transcripts from all previously attended colleges and universities
Two letters of recommendation from former professors or professionals who can comment on your academic and professional potential
A statement of purpose (essay) of 500 words or more describing your academic and professional goals
A current resume
A bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited institution with an undergraduate cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher. Applicants with a cumulative GPA below a 3.0 may submit a letter of appeal for probationary admission.
Undergraduate coursework (12 credits) in the behavioral sciences, such as Psychology, Sociology, Social Work, or other related fields.
Successful completion of an interview with program faculty (required).
International Applicants must meet the International Admissions requirements, including the required English proficiency scores.
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: Kutztown University’s Master of Arts in Clinical Mental Health Counseling program prepares students for employment as master’s level counselors in a variety of mental health settings. Graduates are prepared to practice in community agencies, hospitals, college counseling centers, and other settings where counseling services are offered. The program is designed to fulfill the academic requirements for the Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC) in Pennsylvania. Students learn to provide comprehensive counseling services to clients from a diverse population. The program has a strong focus on professional and personal growth.
Accredidation: The Clinical Mental Health Counseling program is accredited by the Council for Accreditation of Counseling and Related Educational Programs (CACREP).
ScholarshipAmount: $5,000 stipend and a tuition waiver for up to 9 credits per semester

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Marriage, Couple and Family Counseling
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to take an English proficiency exam. Minimum scores accepted are: TOEFL score of 79 on the IBT (internet-based) exam, IELTS score of 6.5, Duolingo English Test score of 105, Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic score of 53, or successful completion of the ELS Language Center's intensive Level 112.
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: Kutztown University’s Master of Arts in Marriage, Couple and Family Counseling program prepares students to work with individuals, couples, and families on a wide variety of clinical concerns. The 60-credit hour program fulfills the educational requirements for students to become Licensed Professional Counselors (LPC) in Pennsylvania and most other states, as well as providing the necessary coursework to pursue licensure as a Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT) in Pennsylvania and most other states. The curriculum is designed to help students develop the awareness, knowledge, and skills necessary to become culturally competent counselors. In addition to core coursework, students complete a 100-hour practicum and a 600-hour internship experience. The Marriage, Couple and Family Counseling program is accredited by the Council for Accreditation of Counseling and Related Educational Programs (CACREP).
Accredidation: The Marriage, Couple and Family Counseling program is accredited by the Council for Accreditation of Counseling and Related Educational Programs (CACREP).

ProgramName: Master of Science in School Counseling
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English are required to take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) exam.
Department: College of Education
Description: The Master of Science in School Counseling program at Kutztown University is a 60-credit program that is designed to prepare highly qualified professional school counselors to work in K-12 school settings. This program emphasizes a developmental, proactive, and preventative approach. Graduates are prepared to perform a wide range of services including individual and group counseling, classroom guidance, consultation, and coordination of services. Our graduates help children and adolescents with their academic, social, emotional, and career development needs. In addition, graduates are qualified to work towards licensure as a professional counselor (LPC) in Pennsylvania and most other states.
Accredidation: Kutztown University is accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education, 3624 Market Street, Philadelphia, PA 19104 (267-284-5000). Additionally, the M.S. in School Counseling program is accredited by the Council for Accreditation of Counseling and Related Educational Programs (CACREP).

EnglishScore: Kutztown University requires a certain level of English proficiency for our international students. You can meet this requirement in one of the following ways: TOEFL: a minimum score of 79 (iBT) or 550 (pBT); IELTS: a minimum score of 6.5; Duolingo English Test: a minimum score of 100; Successful completion of the ELS Language Center's Level 112.
Requirements:
Applicants for the Autism Endorsement Certificate must meet the following admission requirements:

- A bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited institution.
- A minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0.
- A copy of the applicant's Pennsylvania Level I or Level II teaching certificate. Candidates must be certified in an area of special education or early childhood N-3, elementary K-6, reading specialist, school counselor, or school psychologist.
- Completed KU graduate application.
Department: College of Education
Description:
Kutztown University's 12-credit program for the Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASD) Endorsement Certificate is designed for Pennsylvania certified educators. This endorsement may be added to an existing Level I or Level II certificate.

This non-degree graduate program prepares candidates with the knowledge and skills necessary to become effective teachers of students with autism. Candidates will learn how to:
- use evidence-based practices to teach students with autism,
- understand the characteristics of students with autism,
- create individualized programs for students with autism,
- perform assessments, and
- collaborate with families and other school personnel.

The program is approved by the Pennsylvania Department of Education (PDE) and is offered fully online. Candidates have up to six years to complete the four required courses. Upon completion, they can apply to the PDE for the endorsement to be added to their teaching certificates.

The KU ASD Endorsement curriculum is aligned with the Council for Exceptional Children (CEC) and the PA Department of Education (PDE) standards for the preparation of special education professionals. As part of this program, candidates learn about research in the field of ASD, best practices for instruction of students with autism, and methods for making data-based decisions in the classroom. Emphasis is placed on candidates' abilities to understand students' rights and advocate for effective educational practices.
Accredidation: The program is approved by the Pennsylvania Department of Education (PDE).

EnglishScore: All international applicants must demonstrate a satisfactory level of English proficiency. This can be met by providing an official score report from one of the following: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) with a minimum score of 79 on the Internet-based version or 550 on the paper-based version; IELTS (International English Language Testing System) with a minimum band score of 6.5; Duolingo with a minimum score of 100; ELS (English Language Services) with successful completion of Level 112 of the ELS English Language program; or PTE Academic (Pearson Test of English) with a minimum score of 53.
Requirements:
Completed online application.
A copy of current Level II Pennsylvania Teaching Certificate.
A minimum of five years of successful teaching experience in the area sought on the supervisory certificate.
Official transcripts from all colleges/universities attended.
Two letters of recommendation. It is required that one letter be from your current supervisor.
An essay explaining why you are seeking a supervisory certificate in curriculum & instruction.
A current resume.
Interview with program coordinator may be required.
A 3.0 or higher cumulative GPA from an undergraduate degree-granting institution.
Department: College of Education
Description: Kutztown University's Curriculum and Instruction Supervisory Certificate program prepares candidates to serve as supervisors of curriculum and instruction in Pennsylvania's schools. The primary goal of the program is to provide students with the ability to work with teachers, administrators, and the community to improve educational programs for all students. The program is designed to create reflective supervisors who can provide curriculum leadership to schools. The Curriculum and Instruction supervisory program is a 21-credit program that may be used toward Act 48 requirements. Upon completion of this program, students may apply to the Pennsylvania Department of Education for a Curriculum and Instruction Supervisory Certificate.

EnglishScore: All international students are required to show proof of English language proficiency. Kutztown University will accept the following as proof of English proficiency: Duolingo score of 100 or higher, TOEFL iBT score of 79 or higher, IELTS score of 6.5 or higher, or successful completion of the ELS Language Center's level 112.
Department: College of Education
Description: The English as a Second Language (ESL) Program Specialist Certificate is a post-baccalaureate teacher certification program. Teachers who currently hold a Level I or Level II teaching certificate in any area are eligible for this program. This program is specifically designed to meet the needs of certified teachers who wish to work with English Language Learners (ELLs) in their classrooms. Kutztown University's ESL Program Specialist Certificate is approved by the Pennsylvania Department of Education (PDE) and is designed for teachers who wish to add the ESL Program Specialist certificate to an existing Instructional I or II certificate. This 18-credit certification program addresses the five domains of the PDE ESL Program Specialist standards.
Accredidation: Approved by the Pennsylvania Department of Education (PDE).

Requirements: Completed Application, Bachelor's Degree from a regionally accredited institution, Official transcripts from all institutions attended, A current resume, Two letters of recommendation, A valid PA teaching certificate, Evidence of at least three years of teaching experience in PA.
Department: College of Education
Description: This 18-credit program prepares certified teachers to serve as instructional coaches in K-12 school settings. The instructional coach endorsement can be added to an existing Level I or Level II Pennsylvania teaching certificate. All of the courses in the program can be taken online.

ProgramName: Master of Education in Instructional Technology
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English are required to submit proof of English language proficiency. Kutztown University accepts the following: TOEFL: minimum 79 iBT, IELTS: minimum 6.5, DUOLINGO: minimum 100. Students who do not meet the English requirement may be considered for conditional admission through our ESL Pathways program. Waivers for this requirement are available on a case-by-case basis. If you graduated from a U.S. university or a university in one of the countries listed on the university's international admissions page, you may be eligible for a waiver.
Department: College of Education
Description: The M.Ed. in Instructional Technology program is a 30-credit, fully online program that will prepare professionals in a variety of fields to design, develop, and integrate technology to enhance learning and performance. The program supports individuals working in Pre K-12 education, higher education, and corporate/non-profit settings. Students in this program will learn how to: create effective, engaging, and accessible technology-based instruction; assess learning outcomes; develop innovative solutions for learning and performance problems; and manage instructional design and technology projects.

EnglishScore: All international applicants who are non-native English speakers must submit proof of English proficiency. Accepted methods include TOEFL (79 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (6.5), Duolingo (110), ELS (Level 112 certificate), or PTE (53). Proof is not required from applicants who hold a bachelor's or master's degree from a regionally accredited U.S. university or college.
Requirements: This 24-credit certification program is for individuals who already possess a valid Pennsylvania Instructional I or II certificate. General application requirements include a completed application, a non-refundable $35 application fee, and official transcripts from all colleges/universities attended.
Department: College of Education
Description: The Instructional Technology Specialist Certification Program is designed to prepare students to be leaders in the field of instructional technology. This program addresses the state and national standards for instructional technology specialists and prepares certified teachers to provide leadership and coordination for improving teaching and learning in P-12 schools through the effective use of technology. The program provides a broad background of knowledge, skills and tools that are essential to integrating educational technology resources into the P-12 environment.

EnglishScore: All international applicants who are not native speakers of English must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met by providing an official score report for one of the following: TOEFL: 79 (Internet-Based Test), 550 (Paper-Based Test); IELTS: 6.5; Duolingo: 110; ELS: Completion of Level 112; Pearson (PTE): 53.
Requirements: Applicants for admission to the Master of Library Science (M.L.S.) must meet the general admission requirements of the university. In addition, admission to the program will be based on the following: 1. A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. 2. A final undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 point scale. 3. Two letters of recommendation. 4. A goal statement outlining the applicant's reasons for wanting to pursue the M.L.S. degree and how this degree will help them reach their professional goals. A resume is also requested.
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Fees: $25,771.68 (PA Resident) - $35,059.68 (Non-Resident) for the entire 36-credit program, based on 2023-2024 rates.
Description: The Master of Library Science (MLS) program prepares graduates for professional positions in school, public, academic, and special libraries. The program is offered entirely online. Our graduates lead in the field and are shaping the library of the 21st century. The Master of Library Science (MLS) program at Kutztown University is a 36-credit online program for individuals who wish to work in professional positions in school, public, academic, and special libraries. Concentrations are available for students who wish to specialize their studies. Courses are offered online both synchronously and asynchronously.
Accredidation: The Master of Library Science program at Kutztown University is accredited by the American Library Association Committee on Accreditation, with the status of Continued accreditation. The next comprehensive review visit is scheduled for Fall 2028.

ProgramName: Master of Library Science (MLS) plus Initial Certification or Extension of Certification
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. Accepted methods include TOEFL with a minimum score of 79 (iBT) or 550 (PBT), IELTS with a minimum score of 6.5, Duolingo with a minimum score of 105, Pearson (PTE) with a minimum score of 53, or completion of ELS Language Center's level 112. Completion of a bachelor's or master's degree from an accredited U.S. institution of higher education also fulfills the requirement.
Requirements: Admission to the MLS or MLS plus Initial Certification programs requires applicants to apply for admission to the Graduate School. Requirements include: A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA in an undergraduate degree program. Official transcripts from all institutions of higher education attended. A current resume. An essay of 250-500 words describing the applicant's reasons for pursuing a Master of Library Science and his/her related experiences and goals. Two letters of recommendation from individuals familiar with the applicant's academic and/or professional abilities. Applicants for the Extension of Certification program must hold a master's degree and a current initial teaching certificate.
Department: College of Education
Concentration: Initial Certification in Library Science, Extension of Certification in Library Science
Description: This is an online program that allows students to choose one of two options: A) Initial Certification in Library Science for students who hold a teaching certificate in another content area and wish to pursue a career as a school librarian. B) Extension of Certification in Library Science for students who hold an initial certification in another content area and an Instructional Technology Specialist certificate and wish to pursue a career as a school librarian. Both options require a 36-credit program of study. In addition to coursework, candidates seeking initial or extension of certification must meet all PDE requirements including passing the Library Science Praxis exam. Candidates in both options can choose to add the KU online endorsement in Online Teaching for an additional 6 credits.
Accredidation: The MS in Library Science program is accredited by the American Library Association (ALA). The College of Education holds accreditation from the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

ProgramName: Master of Education in Multicultural Education
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS) exam, Duolingo English Test, or PTE Academic. Successful completion of level 112 at an ELS Language Center is also accepted.
Requirements:
A completed graduate application.
A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution with a minimum GPA of 3.0 or higher.
Official transcripts from all institutions attended.
Two letters of recommendation from professional or academic references.
A 500-word personal essay that addresses the applicant's reasons for pursuing a master's degree in Multicultural Education, their experiences and background related to the field, and their professional goals.
A current resume.
An interview with the Program Coordinator (required for some applicants).
Department: College of Education
Fees: Estimated total program tuition: $17,880 for PA Residents, $25,620 for Non-Residents
Description:
The 30-credit Master of Education in Multicultural Education program at Kutztown University is designed to prepare educators and other professionals to be leaders and advocates for social justice in a variety of school and community settings. Students in this program will learn to:
Examine historical and sociopolitical relationships between marginalized groups and dominant societal institutions, such as education, government, etc.
Critically analyze their own identity development and cultural positionalities
Acquire knowledge of diverse cultural groups
Develop a critical consciousness through which they may develop and apply an equity pedagogy and become advocates for social justice for diverse groups in their schools and communities.
This program does not provide teacher certification.
CostPerCredit: $596 for PA Residents, $854 for Non-Residents (including online fee)

EnglishScore: Official results of the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or Duolingo English Test are required for applicants whose native language is not English. Minimum TOEFL score of 79 (IBT), IELTS score of 6.5, or Duolingo score of 100. Successful completion of level 112 at an ELS Language Center is also accepted. The requirement may be waived for students who have earned a bachelor's or master's degree from an accredited institution in the U.S., or for students from countries where English is the official language.

A personal essay describing your qualifications for entry into this program. Two letters of recommendation. One recommendation must be from an individual who has knowledge of the applicant's academic abilities. Current resume detailing years of teaching experience. A valid PA Level II teaching certificate or Educational Specialist certificate. Proof of three years of satisfactory school experience (K-12). Verification of U.S. citizenship.
Department: College of Education
Description: The PreK-12 Principal Certification at Kutztown University prepares candidates to become transformational leaders in 21st-century schools. Our program leads to Pennsylvania Level I Certification as a PreK-12 Principal. The program is designed to meet the academic requirements for the principal certification as set by the Pennsylvania Department of Education (PDE). It follows a cohort model that allows you to work with a dedicated group of students and instructors throughout your program. You'll work with an experienced advisor to plan a program that fits your academic and career goals. KU's PreK-12 Principal Certification is recognized by PDE as a graduate-level program offered by a college of education that has National Council for the Accreditation of Teacher Education (NCATE)/Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP) and Middle States Commission on Higher Education (MSCHE) accreditation.
Accredidation: KU's PreK-12 Principal Certification is recognized by PDE as a graduate-level program offered by a college of education that has National Council for the Accreditation of Teacher Education (NCATE)/Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP) and Middle States Commission on Higher Education (MSCHE) accreditation.

ProgramName: Master of Education in Reading Specialist
EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate proficiency in the English language. This can be met with a minimum score of 79 on the TOEFL iBT, 550 on the TOEFL PBT, 6.5 on the IELTS, 105 on the Duolingo English Test, 53 on the PTE, or by successfully completing ELS Level 112. This requirement may be waived for applicants who have earned a degree from a regionally accredited U.S. college or university or from a country where English is the official language.

Official transcripts from all institutions of higher education attended. A 3.0 or higher undergraduate cumulative GPA. Pennsylvania Instructional I or II teaching certificate. Two letters of recommendation from professional or academic sources. Personal Essay outlining your career goals and motivation for pursuing a degree in Reading.
Department: College of Education
Description: The Master of Education in Reading is a 33-credit program designed to prepare certified teachers to work as reading specialists, literacy coaches, and/or supervisors of reading. The program prepares graduates to work with K-12 students who have difficulties with reading and writing and to work with other teachers to improve reading and writing instruction. It has a strong clinical component that provides graduate students with opportunities for practical application of assessment and instructional strategies. The program's content is aligned with the standards of the International Literacy Association, the International Dyslexia Association and the PA Department of Education. Our program is nationally recognized by the International Literacy Association.
Accredidation: Our program is nationally recognized by the International Literacy Association.

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met by submitting one of the following: a minimum TOEFL score of 79 (iBT) or 550 (pBT), a minimum IELTS score of 6.5, a minimum Duolingo English Test score of 100, a minimum PTE Academic score of 53, or completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center.
Department: College of Education
Description: The Reading Specialist Certification program at Kutztown University is a 24-credit program designed for candidates who have a master's degree and a valid PA teaching certificate. This program leads to an additional certification for educators to support literacy instruction in a variety of school settings. After passing the required Praxis Exam, candidates in this program who have at least two years of successful teaching experience are eligible for certification. Upon completion of the program, students will be able to: Demonstrate knowledge of the foundations of reading and writing processes and instruction. Demonstrate the ability to use a wide range of instructional practices, approaches and methods, including technology, for learners at all levels. Demonstrate the ability to use a variety of assessment tools and practices to plan and evaluate effective reading and writing instruction. Demonstrate the ability to create a literate environment that fosters reading and writing by integrating foundational knowledge, instructional practices, and assessments. Demonstrate the ability to view professional learning and leadership as a career-long effort and responsibility.
Accredidation: Our program is also accredited by the International Dyslexia Association (IDA).
CollegeApplicationFee: $785.45 per semester for full-time students (9+ credits) or $83.45 per credit for part-time students.

Description: The Master of Education in Secondary Education degree at Kutztown University prepares already-certified teachers to become leaders in their schools and in the profession. The goal of the program is to develop teacher-leaders by expanding and deepening their content knowledge, their pedagogical skills, and their understanding of the social context of schooling. In consultation with a graduate advisor, candidates pursue one of several concentrations. They develop advanced skills in their specialty area and gain valuable experience designing and implementing a classroom-based research project.

In addition to meeting the academic requirements, candidates for Level II Certification must have three years of successful teaching on a Level I certificate in their certification area and have completed a PDE-approved induction program.

Completion of the ELS Language Center's level 112.

Description: Kutztown University's Special Education Certification Program provides graduate students with the knowledge, skills, and values to effectively meet the complex challenges of teaching exceptional learners. Upon successful completion of the certification program and all Pennsylvania Department of Education (PDE) requirements, graduates are eligible for Pennsylvania's Special Education PK-12 certification. This program focuses on evidence-based instructional practices for teaching children and youth with disabilities. Candidates have the opportunity to work collaboratively with professionals in the fields of Special Education and Elementary Education. Candidate performance is evaluated through field-based experiences, instructional design and delivery, and research and theory application. Candidates are also evaluated through the development of a professional portfolio.
Accredidation: All certification programs at Kutztown University are accredited by the Pennsylvania Department of Education (PDE). In addition, the Special Education program is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

ProgramName: Doctor of Education in Transformational Teaching and Learning (EdD)
EnglishScore: All international applicants must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met by submitting one of the following: a TOEFL iBT score of 79, an IELTS score of 6.5, a Duolingo score of 100, a PTE score of 53, or completion of ELS Language Center Level 112. A waiver may be available for applicants who have completed a degree from an accredited U.S. institution or a country where English is the language of instruction.
Department: College of Education
Description: Kutztown University's Doctor of Education in Transformational Teaching and Learning is an innovative and flexible program designed to meet the needs of working professionals. Through our cohort model, you will have the opportunity to collaborate and build relationships with a professional learning community as you complete this 60 credit post-master's program. In the Ed.D. in Transformational Teaching and Learning, you will examine the complexities of teaching and learning in an ever-changing world. This advanced degree is designed for those who wish to transform their professional practice and become leaders in the field of education. Upon completion of this program, you will have developed the skills and knowledge to address critical issues within PK-12, higher education, and related educational organizations. The program focuses on four key domains: Leadership, Curriculum & Pedagogy, Professional & Community Development, and Diversity & Social Justice. These domains are integrated throughout the program coursework and culminating dissertation.

Description: The Visual Impairment Certification Program at Kutztown University is the only program of its kind in the state of Pennsylvania. This certification program is available to individuals who hold a bachelor's degree. Students who wish to apply to the certification program must already hold a Level I or Level II teaching certificate in another area of education (e.g., special education, elementary education, secondary education, reading specialist, etc.). Graduates of the program are eligible for the Pennsylvania Department of Education certification as a Teacher of the Visually Impaired (TVI). The program's coursework may be taken entirely online or through a combination of online and on-campus courses. Students in the program take courses such as Introduction to Visual Impairment, Braille I, Braille II, Anatomy & Physiology of the Eye, Methods for Students with Visual Impairments, and Assistive Technology. In addition, students complete field experiences including a practicum with an itinerant TVI and student teaching with a TVI in a center-based school. The coursework is also available as a track in the M.Ed. in Special Education.
CostPerCredit: $688.55 per credit for PA residents, $946.55 per credit for non-residents

ProgramName: Graduate Certificate in School Social Work
EnglishScore: English language proficiency may be demonstrated with an official transcript from a U.S. college or university with the completion of 24 transferrable credits, including English composition with a grade of 'C' or better or by submitting one of the following official scores: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) score of 79, IELTS (International English Language Testing System) score of 6.5, ELS (English Language Service) level 112, Duolingo English Test score of 105, or Pearson Test of English (PTE Academic) score of 53.
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: The School Social Work certificate is a 12-credit post-master's program that will prepare you to be an effective social work practitioner in a school setting and provides eligibility to apply to be a certified school social worker in Pennsylvania. Kutztown University's Master of Social Work program is accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE), and this certificate is built on that foundation. This program consists of 12 credits taken over 12 months with both online and in-person components. Your fieldwork experience in a school setting provides direct practice experience with diverse populations, and coursework will cover evidence-based practices that focus on the issues and difficulties that impact school-aged children and adolescents. The School Social Work certificate prepares students to deal with issues of violence, trauma, substance abuse, and to gain competence in working with individuals, groups, families and communities.
CostPerCredit: PA Resident: $703.95 per credit ($516.00 tuition + $187.95 fees). Non-Resident: $961.95 per credit ($774.00 tuition + $187.95 fees).

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. The following are acceptable measures of English proficiency: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) - The minimum required score is 79 for the internet-based test (iBT), 213 for the computer-based test (CBT), or 550 for the paper-based test (PBT). IELTS (International English Language Testing System) - The minimum required score is 6.5. PTE Academic - The minimum required score is 53. Duolingo English Test - The minimum required score is 105. Description: The Master of Social Work (MSW) program at Kutztown University is a professional degree that provides students with the advanced knowledge and skills necessary to address a variety of human problems. The program emphasizes the promotion of social and economic justice, multiculturalism, and empowerment of oppressed and vulnerable populations. KU's MSW is built upon a strong clinical foundation with special attention given to evidence-based practice and a behavioral health concentration. Students develop the abilities to implement clinical interventions as well as engage in advocacy and policy practice to meet the needs of diverse clientele in our ever-changing society.
Accredidation: The Master of Social Work program at Kutztown University is accredited by the Council on Social Work Education's Commission on Accreditation.

Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: The Doctor of Social Work (DSW) in Leadership and Innovation at Kutztown University is a practice doctorate designed for social work leaders who want to advance in their career and become innovators in the field. This DSW program is for individuals who possess a Master of Social Work (MSW) degree from a Council on Social Work Education (CSWE) accredited program and have at least three years of post-MSW practice experience. The DSW curriculum has a strong focus on leadership and innovation, providing students with the knowledge and skills needed to address complex social problems. The program emphasizes the use of evidence-based practice and a commitment to social justice. Graduates of the DSW program will be prepared to take on leadership roles in a variety of settings, including nonprofit organizations, government agencies, and private practice. Students in the DSW program have the opportunity to engage in a rigorous course of study that includes both online and in-person components. The program is designed to be completed in three years, and students can choose to attend either part-time or full-time. Classes are offered in a hybrid format, with some coursework completed online and some in-person.

Description: The 12-credit Creative Catalyst Graduate Certificate is a hands-on learning experience for professionals, career changers, or those with non-design bachelor’s degrees who are interested in pursuing an advanced degree in Communication Design. This certificate gives students a foundation in essential design skills and conceptual thinking processes to build a portfolio of communication design work. The Creative Catalyst certificate can serve as a bridge to Kutztown University's Master of Fine Arts in Communication Design (CD MFA) program or as a stand-alone certificate to enhance your creative problem-solving skills.

The program builds foundational skills in creative problem solving, design thinking, strategic foresight, visual communication, and leadership. Students learn to navigate and influence the changing social and business landscapes with an emphasis on research, creative strategy, and social innovation. The program can be completed in as little as 10 months and consists of four, eight-week, fully online classes. This unique certificate can be taken as a stand-alone professional credential or can be stacked with the MFA in Communication Design.

Individuals from other disciplines, as well as individuals already in the workplace, will find that the program will enrich their technological skill set and enhance their career opportunities. The program is offered completely online.

Description: Game development is one of the fastest-growing sectors of the economy, and our students are trained with the skills necessary to join this exciting industry. Our program is a Bachelor of Science (BS) in Game Development which provides a strong foundation in programming, mathematics, and computer science coupled with a variety of game-specific courses and experience. With our comprehensive curriculum, you will learn how to design, develop, test, and publish games for various platforms, including PC, console, and mobile. Our program emphasizes hands-on experience, and students work on real-world game projects throughout their studies. You will learn game design, programming, art, sound, and project management while developing a professional portfolio that will showcase your skills to potential employers. Our Game Development program is designed to prepare students for a successful career in the video game industry, with graduates finding employment as game designers, programmers, artists, quality assurance testers, and project managers. Description: The Art Education minor is designed to provide students majoring in Art with a general overview of the field of art education and its professional practices. Description: A minor in Art History offers students in any major the opportunity to supplement their primary course of study with knowledge of the visual arts from ancient times to the present. In addition to a broad range of courses, the minor requires students to select 12 credits of upper-level courses. The minor in Art History can be an enriching supplement to a variety of majors, including Anthropology, Communications, English, History, Modern Languages, Music, Philosophy, Psychology, and Theatre. Art History students are prepared for careers in galleries, museums, preservation, conservation, education, and graduate study.
